Fields.DialogueText: Gnevny, are you down here? We need to talk about your performance out there.
Ya zdes'! I'm in the magazine. Follow the light if you want to talk, idiot. What do you need me for?
I wanted to make sure that everything -- are you smoking down here? Are you crazy?
I can smoke where I please, Kapitan. It is my magazine, so do not presume to come in here and judge me.
You're leaning on a crate of shells for your AA guns. I can see a pile of gunpowder under your feet.
Are you a coward, Kapitan? I had no idea such was the leader of our little fleet.

Fields.MenuText: There's a difference between cowardice and discretion, Gnevny. And I for one have no intention of dying because of your carelessness.
I am not a coward, but a pointless battle is folly. I think I'm going to leave this one until you explode.
Where are you even getting cigarettes? We haven't been resupplied in some time.

Fields.DialogueText: Different big words for the same small thing.
Huh. Bold move, if completely crazy.
I don't know, a guy gave them to me. Get off my back, why don't you!
There's the alarm, we've got company. Why don't you do something useful and get ready for a fight?
Hah! You might as well leave the rest of the fleet behind.
@BATTLE
What are you going to do, blow smoke at them?
*ALARM*
Grr... As soon as I'm done blasting these Rusalki, I'll make you eat those words!
That's the spirit.
We need to talk about your attitude, Gnevny. I'm getting reports that you're being disruptive with our sailors.
Tell me who's complaining about me and I'll fix it. I will teach them not to be rats.
See, that is exactly what we are trying to avoid here. This is a ship, not a schoolyard. We have to work together.
You are telling me that we should work together, but these krysy we call a crew won't even tell me when they have a problem with me.
Actually, I have several reports that these concerns have been brought to your attention, and you responded with hostility.
I don't see why I should be expected to just sit down and take it when someone is insulting me!

Fields.MenuText: Gnevny, being criticized doesn't mean that you are being insulted. You just need to listen to others' concerns.
You have to because this is a fleet, and we are at war. If you are causing trouble, you will be removed.
I had hoped that the military would stop me from having to deal with children, but here we are.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't need to listen to the mewling of scared children who can't keep up with me!
You can't get rid of me! I am the strongest ship in the fleet! What would you do without me?
Who are you calling a child? Don't you talk down to me!
You need to calm down and--
Da. I bet I know who complained about me. Once we're done here, they're next!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We're not through here.
Kapitan! I cannot stand this treatment! The crew are treating me like a child, and it is infuriating!
Why do you think that is, Gnevny? Can you think of a reason?
Because they are pompous fishermen who refuse to acknowledge my obvious superiority!
Keep trying. I'm sure you'll come to the root of it eventually.
Why else would someone hate me except that they were jealous of my power?
It's possible that your tendency to pick fights isn't helping you get along smoothly.
I do not pick fights! I just stand up for myself. It's not my fault if others cannot handle me!

Fields.MenuText: You need to work on your attitude if you want to be taken seriously by the rest of the fleet.
You need to work on your attitude if you want to get any respect around here and stop being treated like a spoiled child.
You need to work on your attitude, or I'm going to pull your disruptive hull off the line.

Fields.DialogueText: You aren't the boss of me! I can do whatever I want, and everyone will see how powerful I am!
I am not a child! Stop saying that!
You can't do that to me! I'll fight the Rusalki no matter what you say!
Da. All of them on the right side.
Yes, actually. Why does that matter?
Look, I've had three sailors with black eyes this week.
My mark. It makes an example of those who would cross me.
Gnevny, one of them told you to stop using his plate for an ashtray!
He should stop eating where I smoke!
*ALARM*
Well? What are you standing around for? We've got Rusalki to smoke!
@BATTLE
You weren't too shabby out there today, Gnevny. Good work.
Not too shabby? Kapitan, I was destroying the enemy! I sent witches to the bottom with no respite for them.
You fought well, but you didn't follow orders well. And that's also important.
How? Killing the witches is the most important part of the battle! It's the only part that matters!
No, you were frequently out of position and left the other ships open to enemy fire.
It is not my fault they are not as strong as I am. They should be able to fend for themselves.

Fields.MenuText: That's not how the fleet works, Gnevny. You have a duty to the men and women fighting alongside you.
In a perfect world they would, but we don't live in a perfect world, now do we?
You will stay in position and protect your teammates, or I'll see you put in dry dock.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't ask for that! I'm here to fight, not to babysit!
I don't see why that's my problem! I didn't tell them to be so weak!
Just try it. I can leave the fleet whenever I want.
Stow it. I hear the alarm. The Morganas must be back for another go.
Good. Zamechatel'no! Maybe this time I won't need to hold anyone's hand.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Gnevny, I need to - are you smoking in the magazine again? What is wrong with you?
Bah, the cigarette is a good light. Helps me read in here.
Why are you reading by cigarette light in the magazine? That's insane!
Nyet! It's not. No one would dare bother me while I am reading in here. I value my privacy, Kapitan.
They don't come down here because they're worried you're going to blow them to kingdom come.
And you're not. Maybe you're not the coward you pretend to be.

Fields.MenuText: You're the one who chose me.
Now I understand why your crew spends so much time loitering near the lifeboats.
Are you at least reading something worth risking the lives of everyone on this ship for?

Fields.DialogueText: What you humans lack in strength you make up for in deceit. If I find out you deceived me into picking you, it's your head.
They do what? Those layabouts! I will give them an earful when I finish in here.
Of course, Kapitan! I wouldn't waste my time reading frivolous garbage like the fancy girls.
We can worry about that later. We have a fleet engagement within the hour, and I need you ready.
I'm always ready, Kapitan. What are you implying?
I'm implying that a certain someone tends to schedule her smoke breaks for right before a fight.
Khorosho. I will not go on break to smoke.
That's not what I meant.
It's what you'll get. Make the best of it.
@BATTLE
The way I see it, it's not my fault that the onions were so close to...
Gnevny, look where you're going!
*GRIIIIIIIND*
Gah, what does that hag think she's doing! Look at my paint now! I might even be taking on water.
Gnevny, you ran alongside her. I tried to tell you to change course at least four times.
She should have gotten out of my way! This is not my fault!
Oh, it absolutely is. You have an assigned position within the formation, and you need to stay in it.

Fields.MenuText: Since you can't, it seems like you're a danger to yourself and your crew.
What were you thinking allowing yourself to drift that close to another ship in the first place?
It looks as if both of you only took minor damage. Thank goodness. This could have been deadly!

Fields.DialogueText: It's not my fault, Kapitan. I have to compensate for our useless helmsman. He should be blamed, not me!
It was her own fault for not getting out of the way! She should have steered clear of me.
It would have served her right for crashing into me like that!
We don't have time for this. The picket ships are sounding the alarm. Get to action stations and we'll do an inspection afterwards.
Careful where you steer me. I will not have my injured flank exposed like some wounded deer!
@BATTLE
So, what's the damage? We'll have to divert course if we need to dry dock.
It's not my fault she can't keep her fat hull...
I said damage report!
A bent railing, a misaligned AA gun, since fixed, a lot of hull that will need some new paint, and a fair amount of hammering... No need for dry dock, Kapitan.
Good, keep me informed on repairs. I need everyone in this fleet operational and at their best.
Right, Kapitan. Um...
Yes?
Gnevny?
I wanted to say, it's... possible I should have been watching better.

Fields.MenuText: Good. Don't let it happen again.
That's not an apology, and I'm not the one you should be apologizing to in any case.
I'm glad you're capable of admitting as much. Remember that feeling next time you start to lose focus.

Fields.DialogueText: Pah. Da, Kapitan.
Fine. I'll send over a message.
You don't need to guilt me, Kapitan. I already feel bad enough.
There's the alarm. Try to stay in your lane this time, all right?
@BATTLE
The whole sea is my lane. But if it helps us fight the Rusalki, I suppose I can allow the other girls to exist in it.
*ALARM*
Good enough.
But I don't have to like it.
You did well out there today, Gnevny. I saw you land some good hits on the Morganas, and you didn't get very far out of position.
Spasibo, Kapitan. I guess some acknowledgement is better than none.
Do you have something to say, Gnevny?
I just don't think it's my fault if I drift a bit. I can't go too fast or the seams start to leak.
Seams? Have you been inadequately repaired? We can schedule dry dock time.
No, they've always done that. I think mine might leak more than the other girls, not that I'm one to complain.
Most ships are expected not to leak at all.
What? Wait... What!?

Fields.MenuText: Do you have a copy of your blueprints or some such? I'd like to do an inspection, if at all possible.
I think I might be seeing the source of some of your issues. We need to delve into this.
It's nice to know I'm sailing with most of a ship.

Fields.DialogueText: No, those are classified. But I can give you a tour if you need one.
I don't have issues! There's nothing wrong with me! Why do you joke with me about leaks!?
Do not mock me! I am a full ship! I am strong!
Damn, the alarm. We'll have to dig into this later. For now, call action stations and try not to get scuttled.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
So I have been talking with the crew about your mechanical issues, and...
What!? You are talking to my crew behind my back? How dare you!
I'm the captain, and I will talk to whomever I please. I've been doing it since you came to the fleet. You spend enough time hidden away that it is significantly easier.
Those traitors! They never told me of this! Why, I should...
Quiet! We have actual problems. The main one being that it is a wonder you are still floating.
What do you mean? I am the toughest ship in the fleet! No one can sink me!
I am genuinely surprised your hull has not ripped itself apart.
It's fine. The groaning helps the crew sleep at night. They love it.

Fields.MenuText: You are a mess, and I am going to have you refitted as soon as humanly possible.
The next time we get the chance, I would like to put you in dry dock and see if there's anything we can do for you.
A floating wreck doesn't do the fleet any good. You need an overhaul.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you can go to the bottom, Kapitan! I am just fine, and I do not need charity.
Hmm... perhaps. There may be things that could be improved.
How dare you! I am not a floating wreck. I am a proud member of the Baltic fleet! I do not need your approval.
We're coming up on the Morganas. Try to avoid sinking out there.
Try to avoid sinking? I'll float on their smoking debris, Kapitan! Just watch me.
Whatever works.
@BATTLE
Stop telling me not to sink before battle, Kapitan!
I'm sorry, did you want to sink? If so, I was very rude.
I am not going to be sunk by anything! I'll show the whole fleet just how tough I am.
That's the spirit. I knew you were cooperative at heart.
Stop it, Kapitan! I am a good fighter, and I do not deserve this disrespect!

Fields.MenuText: You're right. How about this: sink Morganas and not yourself.
I fail to see how a captain issuing orders is disrespectful.
Gee, Gnevny, can't you take a joke?

Fields.DialogueText: Way ahead of you, as usual.
You are annoying, Kapitan. When the First Comrade is annoyed, things explode.
I might when I hear one.
*ALARM*
There's the alarm. Let's see how you do with your new set of orders, shall we?
You think you are so smart, Kapitan. You are lucky that the Rusalki have arrived to soak up my anger.
@BATTLE
Keep an eye on the hull, Gnevny. I think you've got a rivet loose.
Into them! We'll send the Morganas back to the deep!
You heard the kapitan! To battle!
@BATTLE
You did well out there, Gnevny, but I noticed a few things. It looks like your armament slows your turns.
Tak? What of it? This is what gear does, is it not?
Yes, but it slows you more than it should. We should do some exercises, and I'll mark your specifications.
My maneuverability and tolerances are all already on file, Kapitan. What is the point?
No, I have a large folder full of wishful thinking, half written in Italian, that the Red Navy sent me.
Bah!
What I want is the actual knowledge of what you can and cannot do on the battlefield.

Fields.MenuText: It shouldn't be too hard - just a few exercises with the other girls.
It will be a good opportunity for you to show off in front of the rest of the fleet.
This way I can use you to your fullest effect.

Fields.DialogueText: It will be a waste of my time, but if you demand it, it will be done.
Ah, give them something to live up to! I like the way you think, Kapitan.
Bah! You do not use me, Kapitan. I grant you the benefit of my power.
I'll begin preparations immediately.
You'll be disappointed in how pleasantly surprised you are. We're better than those Folgore-class hens we're based on in every way.
Every way? I've heard some of your sisters say otherwise. Boiky--
Yerunda! Boiky doesn't know her stem from her stern! All revolutionary theory and no practice.
You don't want to practice with better equipment? Even if it's just to prove me wrong?
... Fine. I see the game you're playing, Kapitan. I intend to win it.
Gnevny, is your crew ready for the exercises? Gnevny?
Let me finish this chapter, Kapitan. My crew can take care of themselves.
Be that as it may, you are the one who is supposed to be taking care of them. Now get up there!
Just one more page and I will be on my way. Obeshchayu.
What book is that, anyways? It seems to be pretty good at dragging you away from the battle lines.
You know, fewer questions would probably help me finish reading faster.

Fields.MenuText: I was just trying to make conversation with you, seeing as we're about to be destroyed.
You are finished reading, now! Get to the top deck to help observe the exercises.
Oh? It seems like you are already pretty good at ignoring me.

Fields.DialogueText: And you choose to spend your last moments in my company? At least you've got taste.
Bah, you are a slave driver, Kapitan. I am sure the crew will be unhappy to hear of me being treated this way.
I'm sorry, what was that?
Oh, the alarm? How original, Kapitan. Adding realism to the exercise.
This is not a drill. Get up there, now!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
*BOOM*
I'll give you credit, Kapitan - your smoke and mirrors are getting more and more realistic. I'll pop above and give it the Gnevny seal of approval, shall I?
All roads lead to Morganas, I guess.
All right, it looks like the drills will actually get off the ground today. You'll be doing maneuvers with group one.
We are in the water, Kapitan.
I am aware of this, Gnevny. Now bring yourself up to speed.
It's just that you said ground, and we're in the water, so...
Up to speed, Gnevny. Now!
Da, da, there is no need to be so rude. I am speeding up. There, look at me go.
Are you sure this is your top speed, Gnevny? This doesn't seem like...
Da! It is! If you want a better ride, get on one of the other ships, hmm? Maybe they will haul you around. This is a war, Kapitan, not a regatta.
Well, this isn't too bad. At least, I know there are Soviet ships that are worse off.
Grr! I'll show you...

Fields.MenuText: Your maneuverability is going to be a bigger issue. Fleet movements are coming up in a moment.
We'll see how your armament stacks up in a moment, shall we?
And your engines are sturdy enough to maintain this speed for a while. They were built well, at least.

Fields.DialogueText: What? But I don't have time to turn this close!
My guns are the best! Soviet weaponry is superior!
Hah, thank you. Although I could do without the "at least."
Belay the exercises - we've got Morganas! Weapons free, everyone!
@BATTLE
Probably.
Wh-what did you say?
You know, you may be on to something.
About?
Nobody uses my gear better than me. But once or twice I've found myself wanting to make a tighter turn here and there.
Da, Kapitan. And when I track down the dirty zmei who sabotaged my design, I'll roast them alive with my new and improved equipment!
Do you think a refit might solve that?
*ALARM*
... Fair enough.
All right, maneuvering exercises are over for today. That was fairly painless, wasn't it?
If you don't count the scratched paint and bruised bodies, yes.
I did say fairly. It looks like we're going to have to do a fair amount of work to get everyone working together properly.
You swing much wider in your turns than I was told you should.
I told you, that's not my fault! If someone would fix this hull...
I know! You don't have to tell me something isn't your fault when it isn't.
We'll get you overhauled at the next dry dock, and we'll keep up the drills until then. Weapons are next.
I think we should do maneuvers again. Weapons are a waste of time.

Fields.MenuText: What problem are you hiding this time?
I know your guns work. I've seen them fire. What's the problem?
Weapons. Are. Next.

Fields.DialogueText: No problem, Kapitan. I just really feel like having more time to practice maneuvering will benefit me more than time spent testing weapons.
They fire just fine, but I'd rather be tossing shells at the witches than lobbing them into the water just to see if they work.
You heard the kapitan! Bring the guns about, those that can! And try not to shed a tear for the wasted shells.
*ALARM*
Kapitan, the alarm! It looks as though I have targets to test myself on.
@BATTLE
It's not a waste of shells if we learn something, you know.
That knowledge isn't going to last forever. You've seen how the Rusalki learn. Why not make every shot count?
If we've reached that point, it's already too late.
Chert poberi! Just set me loose in a sea swarming with the witches. Nothing but smoking hulks as far as the eye can see...
All right, Gnevny, I was watching you. You were out of position once during that battle. Explain yourself.
It was nothing, Kapitan. Engine trouble. We have it fixed now.
Uh-huh. I'm sure you will have no issue with continuing the weapons testing?
Oh, I think the crew probably deserves a rest, don't you?
I think you need to tell me what's wrong with your guns that makes you shy away from planes.
What are you talking about, Kapitan? I am scared of nothing!
I saw you hiding from the enemy bomber flight.

Fields.MenuText: Are you afraid of planes? I suppose that'd be normal for a ship, come to think of it.
You have a duty to the rest of the fleet, and if you cannot perform it, I need to know.
That sounds exactly like the act of a coward to me. Am I wrong?

Fields.DialogueText: I am not afraid! I just do not like them at all. They are unnatural!
I can perform my duties, Kapitan! Do not presume to tell me I cannot.
I am not a coward! I am brave! I will fight for the fleet!
We're about to have a fight on our hands. It's time to prove it.
@BATTLE
You know hiding from them won't make you any less of a target.
I was not hiding! I was... snubbing them.
Snubbing the planes.
Cheating hunks of junk, flapping around like butterflies... How can you stand them, Kapitan? If they don't come down here for a fair fight, I won't show up for one!
You'll stay hidden in your pile of crates.
Don't you talk about my sniper's nest that way! My strategies are infallible! Inscrutable to smaller minds!
*ALARM*
All right, I think I see the problem. The AA guns that you have are something of a handicap.
They are terrible! Less than worthless! I cannot believe I have to carry them!
That might be a little bit harsh, I think. It's not like they themselves will kill you.
Da, but the moment I must rely on them to protect myself I am dead! And so is my crew!
That's more accurate. But that just proves why we need to do these exercises, so we can pinpoint where your problems lie.
Why, so you can mock me? You want me to be the joke of the fleet?
So we can cover you. You are a strong ship, but none of us can do everything.

Fields.MenuText: If you actually work with the rest of the fleet, we'll protect you like you protect us.
This is why you don't get to do whatever you want. You have to help the others so they can help you.
And if you refuse to see that, you will leave the fleet, or you will die.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't need protecting! But... I can be helpful to protect the others.
Bah. They should not need my help, but I will see what I can do.
Ooh, death. Spooky. And yet less spooky every day I thumb my nose at it.
Beg and plead and grovel, yes. I think the Morgana fleet is regrouping, so get ready for another pass.
@BATTLE
Look at it this way. You've come this far with suboptimal equipment. Imagine how the other girls with all their shiny new toys must feel.
They are rather spoiled, aren't they?
Ha! When they see what I have to put up with, they'll beg me to tell them how I do it!
Rotten. Like a favorite grandchild.
I have been getting some reports from your crew recently I thought I should discuss with you.
What are those traitorous excuses for my comrades saying about me now?
They are saying you are becoming somewhat easier to work with, which I found interesting.
Somewhat? I can't help it if their hurt feelings send them into a spiral of despair whenever they don't get their way.
They also wanted to submit a formal request that you stop smoking in the magazine.
Da? Well, then they had better not hound me wherever I do decide to smoke. Endless requests for my time bore me.

Fields.MenuText: I appreciate that you're taking the time to listen to the requests this time. I feel like this is a sign of progress and maturity.
You should listen to your crew a bit more. They don't know you as well as you know yourself, but they see a lot.
Do it, Gnevny. You have a chance to actually raise the morale of your crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Bah. I would never dismiss something out of hand. Unless an idiot or a whiner said it to me.
Bah. They know nothing of the workings of my insides. I do not care how long they have served. But I will listen.
Bah. If this is what it takes to appease them. But I draw the line anywhere else aboard me.
Good. We have a war to fight out here, and preferably not on our own ships.
Speaking of annoyances, there is the alarm! Let's get to it!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'll give them this, Kapitan. They're toughening up.
You think so?
Before they would have gone to you to try and put a stop to me right away. Official channels are slower. Eventually they will give up altogether.
That's your plan? Annoy people until you get your way?
It seems to work for you.
I have something I want you to do for me, Gnevny.
Have I not done enough for you already? What more could you possibly need?
I need you to do this for yourself. Get together with your crew and come up with a list of changes you want to make.
Oh, I will be making that forever. Did you know that the main pigments used in the creation of...
Let me rephrase that. The changes you want to have made to your structure if we get the chance to dry dock.
Oh, well. That's a far more specific list. But still, I think I can do that. Why?
Because we will be making dry dock sooner rather than later.

Fields.MenuText: Focus on your armaments. I know they've been troubling for you.
I want you able to keep up with the fleet. Try to get your maneuvering up to snuff.
Do whatever you need to do to improve your overall effectiveness.

Fields.DialogueText: I want new AA guns! Oooh, and perhaps new torpedoes! I will think about this!
I know so many little changes to be made! This will be very helpful, Kapitan.
It will be done, Kapitan. Thank you. I will take it to the crew.
Be thinking about it. We have a fleet engagement soon.
This will be perfect. I get to sort out exactly where my designers sabotaged me and I get to root out the whiners among my crew!
I thought they were all a bunch of whiners.
Only most of them, Kapitan. I can tell what's truly a problem and what we can work around.
Is that so?
Of course it's so! These things are only problems for as long as I decide they should be.
You decide to have problems?
Da! Nyet! Shut up and fight!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hah, Gnevny, did I catch you in a good mood?
I was in one, before you interrupted my reading. What do you want, Kapitan?
Funny you should say that. I was actually hoping to ask about the book. I always see you with the same one, but I never see the title.
I wonder why that happened, hmm? Perhaps I do not wish to discuss it with you.
Is that the case? Do you want to keep this book to yourself?
Nyet - of course not. I just worry that you will not be properly appreciative of it.

Fields.MenuText: Why don't you try me? I am sure I can be accepting of your choices.
Is it that terrible? I promise I won't judge you too much out loud.
Anything that can keep you entertained has to be at least partly interesting.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll think about it. It's an important story to me, and I don't share it with just everyone.
See, it is things like that that lead me to believe I cannot trust you with my literary tastes.
Sure, continue to be condescending. See if I decide to give you such an important part of my mind.
All right, I won't press you if you don't wish to tell me right away. It does seem very important to you.
Important enough to risk the ship, you might say. That is the alarm, so we shall speak of it later.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Take your time. It's probably not that noteworthy.
Maybe not to the small-minded. You'll see.
It seems like you're getting the hang of maneuvering with the rest of the fleet. I'm proud of you.
I'm glad things are working out, Kapitan! It feels a little better knowing there are friends around me to help keep the planes off.
It probably also helps that there aren't any more crashes, doesn't it?
I am doing well, Kapitan. There's no reason to mock me for it.
I'm sorry, Gnevny, you're right. I appreciate you taking the time to go through the exercises.
Yes, well, I suppose sometimes it takes some work to get to the point where you are the best.

Fields.MenuText: Don't go getting ahead of yourself. You still have a long way to go before you're the best.
Hah, yes, I'm glad you're doing so well. And I'm sure the rest of the fleet is happy you are covering them.
Your crew is certainly enjoying putting their work in, I can see. They seem to appreciate being prepared.

Fields.DialogueText: Bah, I have always been the best. But I suppose we need other people to treat me as such. Can't have naysayers undoing my deeds.
Yes, well, I am happy they are looking out for me as well. They've learned their place and mine.
It's nice to know they know better. I told you they would get used to me.
Well, we have an engagement in half an hour, so you'll have another chance for your work to pay off.
You will not be disappointed, Kapitan! I am eager to show the enemy the error of their ways.
@BATTLE
I didn't think I'd find you out here, Gnevny. How is smoking in the rain treating you?
Well, it doesn't have the peace and quiet of smoking in the magazine, that's for certain.
But I will admit that it is a little nicer now that I don't need to worry about upsetting the crew.
And by upsetting the crew, I assume you mean causing a massive, ship-rupturing explosion?
The batch of whiners.
I think you have a right to complain when there is a real possibility of your ship exploding, killing everyone instantly.
Are you maligning my attention to detail, Kapitan? Besides, we should not be talking about death. It bores me.
That's more than fair. I don't particularly enjoy talking about exploding myself.

Fields.MenuText: What else do you like to do in your spare time? Just smoke and read?
Are you having fun interacting with the crew more? It seems like they are enjoying your increased presence.
Are there any other members of the fleet you're becoming close with? Any new friends?

Fields.DialogueText: They are excellent pastimes, are they not, Kapitan? Do I need anything else?
Hah, they drink and smoke like champions when they aren't policing me for it. I am considering taking them up on an invitation to their poker game to show them who's boss.
Maybe not new friends, but I am speaking to a few of my comrades more. It is... interesting.
I am glad to hear it, but I do not trust this weather. Does that look like a shape in the rain to you?
@BATTLE
Several, Kapitan. Ugly ones.
You're a real asset to the fleet, Gnevny. Keep up the good work.
Keep up with me. That is the only compliment I require.
I did it, Kapitan! I have a list here of things I would like to change!
Fantastic, Gnevny. What are you asking for?
Psh. If I tell you that, then what's the point of this list? Why not just read it on your own time?
I can't fault you there, Gnevny. All right, thank you for doing as I asked. Was it very hard?
Nyet - there were a lot of problems. And the crew were very polite about helping me write them all down.
That is good to hear. I'd rather you were honest with yourself, so we can get you in the best fighting shape.
I am glad you try to help, but I am always in the best fighting shape.

Fields.MenuText: Let's worry more about the logistics than the semantics until we have you refit.
As long as you aren't threatening to burst on hard turns, you can be pedantic about whatever you wish.
Fine, you are in the best fighting shape you can be. But there is always room for improvement.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, you have a point. Just get me there, will you? I won't rest until the Zhdanov shipyards know what they've been doing wrong.
There is no need to be nasty, Kapitan. I am simply reaffirming a fact.
Yes, yes, there is no need to beat me about the head with it. I am doing the exercises, after all.
I'll go get the list squared away, but it looks like we're headed right for a battle. Get everything stowed away, will you?
@BATTLE
The crew's already on it. They learned a long time ago.
You didn't hurt them, did you?
I get frustrated when things aren't secured. I throw things when I'm frustrated.
And that is the new course. What do you think? Will your fuel reserves hold up?
Da. Of course, Kapitan. I'll still be sailing when everyone else in the fleet is cut adrift. But why are we diverting so far?
Well, we've received a distress call. It seems like there's Morgana activity in the area and they could use some help.
What's more, they have a fairly well stocked dry dock and will owe us a few favors by the time we push in.
Wait, Kapitan, is this for me? Are we headed out of our way for my benefit?
Maybe. I talked it over with the rest of the fleet, and while there are a few other places to resupply, you aren't the only ship who needs some time ashore.

Fields.MenuText: You've made some friends among the fleet, and even the ones who don't explicitly need it are willing to go out of their way.
It seems like perhaps working with the others has caused you to grow in their estimation.
Don't let it go to your head. This still doesn't mean you're the most important ship in the fleet.

Fields.DialogueText: That's... I had no idea. I am very thankful for them. Can you tell them I said so?
Hah, they are not so bad themselves. Perhaps they can be refitted to keep up with me.
Of course not. Many other things make me the most important ship in the fleet.
We'll have to talk about this later.  It looks like the Morgana presence wasn't a false alarm.
What kind of false alarm can there be for the Rusalki? I can smell their foulness straight to the horizon!
Well, not everyone has your senses.
And don't you forget it!
@BATTLE
We're coming up on the port. Are you looking forward to your refit, Gnevny?
Most assuredly, Kapitan! I am very much excited to see what I can do when I have equipment up to my standards.
By equipment, you meant the entirety of your structure and armament?
Do not mock my torpedoes and my B-13s, Kapitan! The witches will certainly not be in a position to after today.
You're right, Gnevny. Are you ready for the last push into the dock? Our scouts are reporting heavy Morgana presence.
I am more than ready, Kapitan. They will not know what hit them.

Fields.MenuText: All right, remember to stay in formation so you and the other ships can support each other.
Remember to listen to your crew. Things can get dicey this close to shore.
Go ahead and light up if it will steady your nerves. This is going to be a rough fight, I think.

Fields.DialogueText: I did not do all that practice for nothing, Kapitan! We will be like a well-oiled machine!
I'll take their counsel under advisement, Kapitan! Some of them are pretty wise when they're trying to do what I want.
Hah! I am way ahead of you, Kapitan. I shall light up as I "light them up," as I think I have heard the crew say.
Nothing for it but to push, then. Sound action stations and alert the rest of the fleet that we're moving in.
You heard the Kapitan! Let the storm of my wrath descend upon these vile witches!
@BATTLE
I am happy to see you taking an active interest in your refit, Gnevny.
There are so many crates! What all did you get me, Kapitan? Are these new AA guns?
Well, I tried to get everything on your list, but it turns out that you're overloaded as it is. We couldn't quite double your smaller arms.
Oh, that was really a backup, if we could not get the new mine rack. Quantity gets so predictable, but it works.
Are you enjoying the shore leave?
Hah, what little there is of it. The crew are having the time of their lives, but I am mostly catching up on my reading.
Speaking of reading...
Scarlet Sails, by Alexander Grin. I figure you deserve to be told at this point.
It's a book about following your dreams, no matter what. Would you like me to lend it to you when I'm done?

Fields.MenuText: I'd like that, Gnevny. I think it would be fun to know a bit more about you. And you're welcome to borrow one of mine in return.
Please do! I'm fascinated.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll have to take you up on that! You can tell a lot about a person by their tastes. I have a feeling yours will be worth tasting.
I'm not all fire and smoke, Kapitan. My sister Boiky, on the other hand...
See that, Kapitan? That's where my greatness will be recognized!
We've got to clear the area first. If you've ever wanted to show off, now's the time to do it.
Consider this an object lesson for you humans. When it comes to gear, I can turn every single one of your misses into a direct hit!
@BATTLE
